alert.note: Alert for Cass; St. Joseph (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 01 at 6:39PM EDT by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Michigan, including the following counties, Cass MI and St. Joseph MI. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 635 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. 2.68 inches of rain was reported 2 miles south of Howardsville and standing water over 6 inches deep in Dowagiac. - Additional training heavy showers along a Dowagiac to Mendon line will continue through 730 pm EDT. An additional inch of rainfall is possible in portions of northern Cass and northern St. Joseph county. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dowagiac, Marcellus, Mendon, Howardsville, Moore Park and Fishers Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
